intro: Libocedrus dolabrata, commonly known as the California incense-cedar, is a coniferous evergreen tree native to the western United States. It belongs to the cypress family (Cupressaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, reddish-brown bark and scale-like leaves. The tree produces small, cone-like structures that contain seeds, and it is often found in moist, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of the Pacific Northwest and California ecosystems.
